results.title: Buster Keaton : a hard act to follow
results.brief_description: Buster Keaton is now regarded as one of the supreme comedians of the silent American cinema. He was also an inventive and dedicated film-maker who performed all of his own stunts yet took little interest in business arrangements. This is a comprehensive survey of Buster Keaton’s life and work including generous extracts from all his feature films and most of his two-reelers. Narrated by Lindsay Anderson. Ep. 1. (53 min.)—Ep. 2. (54 min.)—Ep. 3. (53 min.) Further reference: http://www.busterkeaton.com

results.title: Business: what's it all about?
results.brief_description: This film presents the operations of four different companies relating to basic business functions, problems, skills needed and the importance of business in everyday life. Shows that certain concepts are common to any business such as profit, the distinction between products and services, research and development, production and manufacturing marketing and distribution. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Business, behaviorism and the bottom line
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: B.F. Skinner discusses theories concerning behaviour modification principles including scheduling, shaping, and positive reinforcement as they are used in education, business and industry.

results.title: Business activity statement : your one report
results.brief_description: This video provides information about the new Business Activity Statement (BAS), introduced with the Goods and Services Tax. It includes examples showing how to complete a BAS. Presented by Michael Caton.

results.title: Bushy, the squirrel
results.brief_description: Designed for use in primary classes. Eight-year-old Steve discovers a squirrel frightening away the birds in his yard. He and his father find the squirrel’s home in a tree in the woods. Making trips to the woods to see Bushy, they discover other forest animals. With patience and perseverance Steve teaches the squirrel to eat from his hand.

results.title: Bushtrak
results.creator_credit: Kingcroft Productions, Ampol Petroleum Ltd and John Kingsford-Smith
results.brief_description: Shows the layout of an obstacle track designed to test physical prowess. Obstacles include climbing nets, climbing bars and swinging ropes. Commentary by Paul Ricketts.

results.title: Bushman
results.brief_description: Discusses the timber industry in New Zealand including tree felling, the process of timber cutting to manufacturing and the lives of workers and their wives.

results.title: Bushfires: your safety and survival
results.brief_description: Made especially for television information purposes, this film is introduced by Sir Henry Bolte, (Premier of Victoria in 1969). It tells how to prevent, prepare against, and fight bush fires. It also explains how to defend your home, property and life when fire threatens.

results.title: Bushfire moon
results.brief_description: It’s the week before Christmas, 1891. The Australian bush is tinder dry as a fierce drought brings an infant nation to its knees. When eight year old Ned O’Day mistakes a roguish ex-miner for Father Christmas, Ned’s firm belief and sense of wonder bring about a startling turn of events. Stars John Waters and Dee Wallace.

results.title: Bushfire brigade
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Eric Thompson
results.brief_description: Illustrates the danger of bushfires and describes how bodies such as the Volunteer Bushfire Brigade and the Forestry Firefighting gangs are organised to prevent and fight bushfires.
